name: The Lodge at Torrey Pines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at The Lodge celebrating our wedding anniversary. From the moment I called to make the reservation, I knew we had made the right choice. The representative explained the property, the different room types, assisted in booking a tee time for my husband for the famed south course, and made our dinner reservations at one of the best restaurants I have ever visited. After reading the few negative reviews noting that the lodge is dark, I think the travelers missed the entire point of the property. It is a LODGE designed in CRAFTSMAN architecture - think dark oak mission furniture. The grounds are immaculate. The views are spectacular. The service is excellent without being overbearing. The staff is well-trained. And, our room was huge. I would highly recommend The Lodge to anyone who appreciates attention to detail, beautiful architecture, and the spectacular California coastline. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Perfection!
Wonderful place
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a night here to celebrate our anniversary and we fell in love with the place. It’s elegant and cozy all at the same time. The views are fantastic, the pool water was almost as warm as bath water and the rooms were large, clean, and very comfortable. The bed was so comfortable that we came home and purchased a mattress just like the one in the room!
I just spent one night here with my teenage daughter while we were touring colleges in San Diego.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, super nice people and great service

reviews.text: We had reserved just their basic room with two queen beds using the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts program. Upon check-in we were upgraded to an enormous room overlooking the golf course and the ocean. The room was huge and the bathroom was enormous, but the best part was the spacious balcony! I spent nearly the entire evening out there - the sunset was spectacular! This room also had a nice gas fireplace - very cozy.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.text: We had lunch in the golf grill - probably the best hamburger I have ever had!
reviews.title: Creepy and stale.

reviews.text: The Lodge at Torrey Pines was magical. I traveled with my husband for a business conference that was a mix of work and play. The building and grounds alone are spectacular and it's hard to believe it was built in 2002. The food was outstanding and the service was the best of any place we've ever stayed. The only negative is that the business center was a "one person at a time space," but therooms are so large and well equipped that there is plenty of space to work in you room if you must. The beach is minutes away, but the 85 degree pool was wonderful. It was heaven!
reviews.title: Beyond Our Expectations

reviews.text: Some type of maintenance was being performed in the hall way right outside my room . It started at 5pm and at about 9pm I finally called the front desk who informed me that they were not sure when the noise would stop. They offered a room change, and I explained to them that I had 2 small children that were already asleep. I told them that the time for a room change would have been at 5pm when they realized that they would be making noise all night.
reviews.title: Horrible Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After about 5 hours of sleep I went down to the front desk and told them that I was so upset that I did not want to continue my stay. The front desk person said that they would refund me not only the night that I just stayed, but also the next night (as I was checking out) when the GM came in he said that he only authorized 1 night credit, and that even though I checked out early he was going to still charge me for the stay.
reviews.title: Best resort ever

reviews.text: Stay away from this hotel!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful even for our young children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 day stay at the Lodge. Everything was impeccable; service, food, room, quiet, mattress comfort, amenities. It's a warm, friendly place, with none of the pretension of similar resorts. The grounds are beautiful and groomed well, just as the interior is immaculate. The two restaurants have excellent food and service. The poolside staff is super accomodating; the views are spectacular. All of this in a quiet, restful environment. In this part of California, a quiet, close to nature place is challenging to find, yet this lodge is located in just such a place. The rooms are beautiful, missing nothing, even in the less expensive internet priced rooms. Staff is always around, offering to help. The spa is also top quality.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place

reviews.text: Classy, expensive lodge on the grounds of the Torrey iPnes Golf Course (Oddly, Torrey Pines, a world famous course, is a municipal golf course.). Everything in the facility is crafted from polished timber. Extremely comfortable accomodations. Great food. There is not much else in terms of bars or restaurants around the lodge, so you'll need a car ( no taxi service was seen during our 3 day stay) if you want to explore San Diego.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lodge overlooking Torrey Pines Golf Course

reviews.text: Can't say more about this place. Service great, attention to detail great, and the grounds are beautiful.
reviews.title: World Class

reviews.text: Recently spent my first (hopefully not my last) two nights at TLATP. I have had a chance to stay at 5 and 6 star rated resorts, and have had a chance to travel internationally. Torrey Pines easily meets or exceeds the standards of comfort, service and ambience of these facilities. It falls just a tiny bit short of an Auberge resort at Punta Ballena outside of Cabo, Mexico. As an Architecture nut, the first thing that struck me was how perfectly the designers had managed to make a modern building look and feel like something Greene and Greene or Frank Lloyd Wright had built at the turn of the last century. Perfect down to the last detail -- including the William Morris print wallpaper in the bathrooms. The views and vistas that face out over the golf course are unreal (makes me wish I played the game) I just wish I had more time to spend there, and that I wasn't stuck in a conference room during most of my stay. The service was excellent and the food was perfect. Could not ask for more, especially on a business trip. I have read reviews by one individual that seemed to miss the point of this resort entirely. Described it as old and stale, like a trip to her grandmother's house. Obviously no student of architecture, history and unable to grasp the fact that this was a top notch quality, entirely modern resort.
reviews.title: Superb comfort, service and ambience. Perfect reinterpretation of Arts and Crafts Architecture.
TLATP is the real deal
reviews.text: We loved it here. Amazing views golf course and ocean from our very spacious room 527, and impeccable service every step of the way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at The Lodge at Torrey Pines. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and comfortable, as are the common areas. The attention to detail makes this a five star instead of a four star. Our room had everything you would expect, and then little extras like the counter as you walk in the door to leave your keys, purse, etc or the second suitcase holder or the desk that accommodates to people with two computers facing each other. The staff likewise went the extra distance to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The breakfast on the golf course was adequate but nothing special. Dinner at their signature restaurant, A.R. Valentin, was very good. Definitely a great spot for golfers!
reviews.title: first rate lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed and played golf here for my husband's birthday. We got a palisades room with a king size bed with the golf view and balcony on the second floor. It was worth it. It was so nice in the mornings that we can just walk to the starter to pick up our clubs and cart and then play golf. When we stay at other resorts, many a times we either have to take a shuttle or drive to the golf course.
reviews.title: Marvelous craftsman style hotel with great views

reviews.text: The room was rather large with a king size bed, a sitting area with a coffee table, a gas fireplace, a table to put your computer on and a beverage bar. It was great that they have free WiFi here. The bathroom was huge with a separate tub and shower and with double sinks.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Wonderful attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved walking around the hotel with the craftsman style look with all the wood and chandeliers everywhere. It was nice you can either use valet parking or self parking with the garage nearby. Parking was an additional at $22 day for self parking. Some of the hotels we stay has a long walk to the parking garage. Hotel is not very large but it made for a cozy stay. Loved the staff here at the Lodge. They made our stay very welcoming.
reviews.title: Wow What Service, What a view, What an experience!!!!

reviews.text: We had breakfast and lunch at the grill, which is on the hotel property. Food was decent and the service was great. Grill can get pretty busy during the day with the golfers eating here too.
reviews.title: Awesome, awesome, awesome

reviews.text: It's a little expensive to stay here but its worth it for those special occasions. It was great that they arranged for us to get a tee time to play both the North and South courses at Torrey Pines golf course (with an advance booking fee).
reviews.title: A Reflection toEarly California - Amazing Hotel

aka: The Lodge At Torrey Pines Hotel La Jolla
description: Guests are greeted at The Lodge's porte-cochère by doormen attired in kilted Scottish Dress. Inside are 170 guest rooms, 12,000 square feet of meeting space, spa, 2 restaurants, and expansive public rooms with fireplaces, comfortable leather chairs and amazing views of the Torrey Pines and the Pacific Ocean beyond. Behind The Lodge is a heated pool with cabanas, whirlpool, croquet lawn, and a large terrace with chaise lounges for basking in the Southern California sun.
